\chapter{Waveguide}
\label{\detokenize{waveguide:module-pyjsa.waveguide}}\label{\detokenize{waveguide:waveguide}}\label{\detokenize{waveguide::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!pyjsa.waveguide@\spxentry{pyjsa.waveguide}}\index{pyjsa.waveguide@\spxentry{pyjsa.waveguide}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Waveguide package, containing tools for manipulating and and constructing waveguide geometry and physical data.
\index{Waveguide (class in pyjsa.waveguide)@\spxentry{Waveguide}\spxextra{class in pyjsa.waveguide}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{waveguide:pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyjsa.waveguide.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Waveguide}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{film\_thickness\_um}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{width\_idx}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{height\_idx}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{length}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{wg\_angle}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{60}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{cladding}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}air\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{profile}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{custom\_poling\_profile}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{custom\_nonlinearity\_profile}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Implements a Waveguide object, which stores information relevant for the LNOI waveguide construction and material properties. The properties of the waveguide like the dispersion relation are stored externally in .npz files in the folder “..data".
\index{GAUSSIAN\_POLED (pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide attribute)@\spxentry{GAUSSIAN\_POLED}\spxextra{pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{CUSTOM (pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide attribute)@\spxentry{CUSTOM}\spxextra{pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{waveguide:pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide.CUSTOM}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CUSTOM}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Attribute for specifying that the waveguide has a custom nonlinearity profile.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{film\_thickness\_um}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Thickness of the LN film used in the fabrication of the waveguide. For the default dataset, values can only be elements of the array {[}0.3:0.1:0.8{]} (micrometers).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width\_idx}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The width of the waveguide. It specifies the index of the element in the (default) array {[}0.5:0.1:2.0{]} (micrometers).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height\_idx}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The height of the waveguide. It specifies the index of the element in the (default) array {[}0.2:0.1:film\_thickness{]} (micrometers).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{length}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The length of the waveguide (meters).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{wg\_angle}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} The angle of the waveguide ridge (degrees). For the default dataset, only the default value of 60 is possible.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cladding}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} The cladding of the waveguide. For the default dataset, only the default value of “air” is possible.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{profile}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} An integer specifying the poling of the waveguide taken from the attributes of the class mentioned above, by default 0.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{custom\_poling\_profile}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy.ndaray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} A custom poling profile to be used if the waveguide is specified to be CUSTOM\_POLED, by default None.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{custom\_nonlinearity\_profile}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{callable}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} A custom nonlinearity profile to be used if the waveguide is specified to be CUSTOM, by default None.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The poling profile that minimizes the error between the target PMF and the resulting PMF.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
np.ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{Pump}
\label{\detokenize{pump:module-pyjsa.pump}}\label{\detokenize{pump:pump}}\label{\detokenize{pump::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!pyjsa.pump@\spxentry{pyjsa.pump}}\index{pyjsa.pump@\spxentry{pyjsa.pump}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Pump package contains only the class Pump, used to compute and store the properties of the pump laser.
\index{Pump (class in pyjsa.pump)@\spxentry{Pump}\spxextra{class in pyjsa.pump}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{pump:pyjsa.pump.Pump}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyjsa.pump.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Pump}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{width}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{points}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1000}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
A class for storing and computing the properties of the pump laser.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Width of the pump spectrum at half maximum (meters).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{points}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} The number of points into which to divide the \(\lambda_i\) and \(\lambda_s\) axis in order to compute the PEF, by default 1000.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\index{center (pyjsa.pump.Pump property)@\spxentry{center}\spxextra{pyjsa.pump.Pump property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{pump:pyjsa.pump.Pump.center}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{center}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
The center of the pump spectrum, inferred from the signal and the idler by energy conservation (meters). Cannot be set.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
float

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{hermite\_mode() (pyjsa.pump.Pump method)@\spxentry{hermite\_mode()}\spxextra{pyjsa.pump.Pump method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{pump:pyjsa.pump.Pump.hermite_mode}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{hermite\_mode}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{x}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{float}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
A normalised Hermite\sphinxhyphen{}Gaussian function in temporal mode 0:
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\frac{e^{-(x_0-x)^2/(2w^2)}}{\sqrt{\sqrt{\pi}w}}H_0(x_0-x)\end{split}
\end{equation*}
\sphinxAtStartPar
where \(x_0\) is the center and \(w\) is the width.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The wavelength (meters).

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
float

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{idler (pyjsa.pump.Pump property)@\spxentry{idler}\spxextra{pyjsa.pump.Pump property}}

\pysigstopsignatures

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Experiment}
\label{\detokenize{experiment:module-pyjsa.experiment}}\label{\detokenize{experiment:experiment}}\label{\detokenize{experiment::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!pyjsa.experiment@\spxentry{pyjsa.experiment}}\index{pyjsa.experiment@\spxentry{pyjsa.experiment}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module is the core of the package. It contains classes and functions that aid in the computation of the PMF, JSA, Schmidt decompostion and in the optimization of the output photon spectral purity.
\index{Experiment (class in pyjsa.experiment)@\spxentry{Experiment}\spxextra{class in pyjsa.experiment}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{experiment:pyjsa.experiment.Experiment}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyjsa.experiment.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Experiment}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{waveguide}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{waveguide:pyjsa.waveguide.Waveguide}]{\sphinxcrossref{Waveguide}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{pump}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{pump:pyjsa.pump.Pump}]{\sphinxcrossref{Pump}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{signal}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{idler}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{SPDC\_type}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
The experiment class incorporates the tools for computing the PMF, JSA, Schmidt decomposition and heralding efficiencies.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pump}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{pump:pyjsa.pump.Pump}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pyjsa.pump.Pump}}}}}) \textendash{} A pump object for the experiment.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{signal}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}) \textendash{} A tuple where the first element is the wavelength of the signal and the second is the width of the window (meters).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{idler}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}) \textendash{} A tuple where the first element is the wavelength of the idler and the second is the width of the window (meters).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{SPDC\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}) \textendash{} The type of the SPDC process. Can only be 0, 1 or 2, by default 0.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{joint\_spectral\_amplitude() (pyjsa.experiment.Experiment method)@\spxentry{joint\_spectral\_amplitude()}\spxextra{pyjsa.experiment.Experiment method}}

\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
A function that computes the JSA for the specified waveguide, pump and signal and idler ranges combination, incorporating filtering, For no filtering, you should set the center and width of the filters to those of the signal and idler
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_signal\_center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The center of the filter on the signal.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_idler\_center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The center of the filter on the idler.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{numpy.ndarray} \textendash{} The JSA.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{float} \textendash{} Probability that the signal passes its filter.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{float} \textendash{} Probability that the idler passes its filter.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{float} \textendash{} Probability that both the signal and the idler pass their filters.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{find\_optimal\_pump\_width() (in module pyjsa.experiment)@\spxentry{find\_optimal\_pump\_width()}\spxextra{in module pyjsa.experiment}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{experiment:pyjsa.experiment.find_optimal_pump_width}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyjsa.experiment.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{find\_optimal\_pump\_width}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{exp}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{experiment:pyjsa.experiment.Experiment}]{\sphinxcrossref{Experiment}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{width\_bounds}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{filter\_signal\_width}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{filter\_idler\_width}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{filter\_signal\_center}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{filter\_idler\_center}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
A function that optimizes the width of the pump of an experiment such that it yields the highest spectral purity. It uses the default optimizer of scipy.optimize.minimize\_scalar.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{exp}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{experiment:pyjsa.experiment.Experiment}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Experiment}}}}}) \textendash{} The experiment whose pump width is to be optimized.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width\_bounds}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy.array}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}) \textendash{} An array with two elements that specifies the bounds of the optimization, ex. {[}0.1, 10{]} (nanometers).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_signal\_width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The width of the filter on the signal.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_idler\_width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The width of the filter on the idelr

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_signal\_center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The center of the filter on the signal.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_idler\_center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The center of the filter on the idler.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The result of the optimization routine.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
scipy.optimize.OptimizeResult

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
